TITLE.value: UK Higher Education Enterprise Capability Model

Description.value: A comprehensive multi-level capability model for UK higher education.

systems.Description: Manages the end-to-end lifecycle of students from application to graduation and alumni.
Handles prospective student applications and admissions decisions.
Maintains applicant personal, identity and history data.
Captures core personal and contact information for applicants.
Captures and manages identity evidence for applicants.
Tracks applications and decisions across cycles.
Verifies prior academic qualifications presented by applicants.
Stores personal statements submitted by applicants.
Captures and stores references or recommendations for applicants.
Evaluates applicants against academic and other entry requirements.
Captures application form data and supporting information.
Assesses applications and makes recommendations.
Creates and manages offers to applicants.
Defines conditions associated with conditional offers.
Issues unconditional offers to eligible applicants.
Tracks applicant responses to offers.
Manages deposits associated with offer acceptance.
Tracks readiness for issuing CAS or equivalent.
Defines and manages rules for withdrawing offers.
Manages communications with applicants throughout the admissions process.
Governs decision-making for admissions including approvals and audit trail.
Validates that applicants have met the conditions of conditional offers.
Manages documents associated with admissions and applications.
Registers and onboards new students into the institution.
Verifies identity of new students for registration.
Verifies student photographs.
Verifies identity documents such as passports and visas.
Validates passport or other identification documents.
Validates visa documentation where required.
Manages the registration status of new students.
Collects required documentation from new students.
Plans and manages induction for new students.
Defines the structure and content of induction programmes.
Schedules induction and orientation sessions.
Manages content for academic induction.
Coordinates welcome events and activities.
Provides safety and wellbeing briefings to new students.
Confirms eligibility for student finance and funding during onboarding.
Performs pre-arrival checks such as immigration, fees and prerequisites.
Administers student enrolment and ongoing programme-level data.
Enables students to select modules within rules and constraints.
Publishes available modules and associated information.
Enforces enrolment rules for module selection.
Applies capacity limits for modules.
Routes module selection for academic approval where required.
Detects timetable clashes and preclusion conflicts.
Manages enrolment of students into programmes and years of study.
Validates co-requisite and pre-requisite requirements for enrolment.
Manages changes to student status such as intermission or transfer.
Manages periods of intermission or suspension of studies.
Manages programme or institution transfer processes.
Validates eligibility for status changes or transfers.
Assesses financial impacts of status changes.
Assesses visa implications of status changes for international students.
Tracks student attendance and engagement for academic and compliance purposes.
Manages academic progression decisions and graduation.
Defines and manages rules governing academic progression.
Configures progression criteria for programmes and stages.
Defines credit thresholds required for progression.
Defines rules for handling failed modules for progression.
Defines rules on compensating marginal failures.
Governs academic boards and exam boards for progression and awards.
Automates eligibility checking for progression and awards.
Manages algorithms and decisions for award classifications.
Configures the algorithms used for calculating classifications.
Defines weighted averaging rules for marks and credits.
Defines rules for borderline classification reviews.
Defines and manages overrides for exceptional cases.
Plans and manages graduation ceremonies and associated logistics.
Defines, delivers and governs assessments and academic academic processes.
Designs and configures assessment structures, rules and accessibility parameters.
Defines assessment types, purposes and attempts.
Defines available assessment types such as exam, coursework, presentation.
Maintains the taxonomy of assessment method types.
Defines the purpose of assessments.
Defines parameters distinguishing formative and summative assessments.
Defines allowed assessment attempts.
Defines rules for first sits, resits and repeats.
Manages weighting of assessments within modules and programmes.
Manages timing and scheduling of assessments and exams.
Defines marking rubrics and assessment criteria.
Configures accessibility requirements and adjustments for assessments.
Enables students to submit assessments and manages handling of submitted work.
Creates and manages assessment submission points and channels.
Validates submissions before acceptance.
Validates file types and sizes for submission.
Manages version control and timestamps for submissions.
Evaluates submissions against late submission policies.
Detects corrupted or unreadable files.
Enables detection of academic integrity issues such as plagiarism.
Provides receipts and confirmations for submitted work.
Manages marking, moderation and feedback publication.
Enables and controls entry of marks for assessments.
Enables and controls anonymous marking processes.
Configures and supports internal and external moderation.
Assigns first and second markers to assessments.
Defines thresholds for mark discrepancies requiring resolution.
Defines triggers for external examiner review.
Manages publication of assessment feedback and marks to students.
Resolves escalated assessment issues and governs assessment policies and procedures.
Adjudicates suspected academic misconduct cases.
Collects evidence for academic misconduct cases.
Captures plagiarism and similarity reports.
Captures statements from markers and witnesses.
Governs panel decision-making.
Defines penalty bands for academic misconduct.
Reviews mitigating factors in misconduct cases.
Enables and governs appeals against academic decisions.
Validates eligibility for resits and repeats.
Governs retention and disposal of assessment records and artefacts.
Provides wellbeing, disability, casework and immigration support to students.
Provides wellbeing and mental health triage, support and crisis management.
Assesses initial wellbeing requests and directs them appropriately.
Assesses risk for wellbeing and mental health cases.
Defines risk categories for wellbeing cases.
Enables protocols for suicidal ideation risk.
Defines conditions that trigger immediate safeguarding action.
Enables scheduling of wellbeing and mental health appointments.
Creates, maintains and reviews wellbeing support plans.
Enables escalation pathways for students in crisis.
Provides disability-related support, adjustments and assistive technology.
Enables assessment of students' disability and accessibility needs.
Plans and maintains reasonable adjustments for disabled students.
Defines types of reasonable adjustments.
Configures extra time rules for exams and assessments.
Manages provision of specialist equipment and software.
Manages provision and support for assistive technologies.
Monitors adherence to accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) across institutional digital content and physical spaces.
Manages academic casework including mitigating circumstances and fitness to study.
Enables students to apply for mitigating circumstances.
Submits and validates evidence for mitigating circumstances.
Defines rules for condonement or deferral decisions.
Manages complex student cases such as fitness to study or disciplinary issues.
Manages non-academic disciplinary cases.
Schedules disciplinary hearings and reviews.
Manages the fitness to study process.
Provides immigration advice and manages institutional compliance for international students.
Provides regulated visa and immigration advice to students.
Manages institutional compliance with visa sponsor duties.
Issues and tracks Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS).
Monitors student engagement for visa compliance reporting.
Maintains required records for regulatory compliance.
Manages student engagement, non-academic services and alumni relations.
Manages communication channels and non-academic interactions with students.
Provides a central, personalised hub for student information and self-service.
Manages non-academic student enquiries and support tickets.
Collects and analyses student feedback on services and experience.
Manages targeted communications to specific student cohorts (e.g., specific year, international).
Manages relationships and engagement with alumni and supporters.
Maintains and updates alumni records.
Manages communications and events for alumni.
Identifies potential donors and nurtures philanthropic relationships.
Manages fundraising campaigns and giving programmes.
Manages the HESA DLHE and Graduate Outcome Survey processes.
Supports the planning, delivery and dissemination of institutional research and knowledge exchange activities.
Defines institutional research strategy and planning.
Defines and manages institutional research themes and priorities.
Plans and allocates internal investment in research infrastructure and projects.
Manages the operation of Doctoral Training Centres or equivalent.
Manages the process of seeking and securing external research funding.
Identifies relevant external funding opportunities for researchers.
Supports researchers in developing competitive grant proposals.
Manages the costing, pricing and institutional approval of research proposals.
Manages the formal submission of grant applications to funders.
Manages the operational and financial administration of successful grants.
Negotiates and signs legal contracts with research funders.
Sets up internal financial codes and project structures for awarded grants.
Monitors grant expenditure against budget and produces funder reports.
Manages the process of claiming funds from sponsors.
Manages internal and external research assessment processes.
Assesses and manages the quality and support of the research environment.
Manages the identification, collection and tracking of research outputs.
Manages the collection and narrative of research impact case studies.
Manages the institutional submission to Research Excellence Framework or equivalent.
Governs research ethics, integrity and compliance.
Manages the operation and review processes of Research Ethics Committees (RECs).
Manages suspected cases of research misconduct.
Ensures compliance with external research regulations (e.g., GDPR, HRA, Animals Act).
Manages activities to transfer knowledge and commercialise research outputs.
Identifies, protects and manages institutional Intellectual Property.
Manages the process of transferring technology to industry partners.
Supports and manages the creation of spin-out and start-up companies.
Manages the provision of institutional and academic consultancy services.
Manages the collection and reporting of knowledge exchange and business engagement metrics (e.g., KEF).
Defines institutional strategy, risk appetite and statutory compliance.
Defines and manages the institutional strategy.
Defines institutional strategic goals and associated KPIs.
Aligns academic, resource, estate and IT strategies to the institutional strategy.
Ensures compliance with sector-specific and statutory regulations.
Manages the collection and submission of statutory returns (e.g., HESA, OFS, SLC).
Manages internal audit programme and remediation tracking.
Ensures compliance with data protection laws.
Manages Freedom of Information requests and responses.
Identifies, assesses and manages institutional risk.
Maintains and updates the institutional risk register.
Defines and monitors institutional risk appetite.
Defines and tracks strategies to mitigate key risks.
Governs academic quality, standards and validation.
Defines and governs the institutional academic standards framework.
Manages validation and periodic review of academic programmes.
Manages the appointment, reporting and payment of external examiners.
Defines and manages the curriculum, catalogue and teaching resources.
Designs and maintains the curriculum structure, modules and catalogue data.
Defines new programmes, pathways and awards.
Defines module content, learning outcomes and prerequisites.
Governs the approval and implementation of curriculum changes.
Publishes the definitive course and module catalogue for internal and external use.
Manages online learning environments and content delivery.
Provides and maintains the core VLE platform.
Supports staff in creating, managing and reusing learning content.
Provides tools for synchronous and asynchronous online collaboration.
Manages the technology and process for capturing and streaming lectures and teaching sessions.
Tracks student activity in the VLE to support engagement monitoring and intervention.
Manages the core financial accounting, general ledger and reporting.
Manages the chart of accounts, postings and financial statements.
Defines and manages the institutional chart of accounts.
Processes and records financial transactions into the general ledger.
Manages the process for monthly and annual financial close.
Manages institutional liabilities to suppliers.
Processes supplier invoices and validates them against purchase orders.
Manages the scheduling and execution of supplier payments.
Manages institutional assets from debtors.
Generates and distributes invoices for non-tuition fees.
Manages receipt and allocation of cash and pursues outstanding debts.
Manages the lifecycle and accounting of institutional assets.
Maintains the register of fixed assets.
Calculates and records depreciation and asset impairment.
Manages banking, liquidity and investments.
Reconciles bank statements with the general ledger.
Manages institutional investments and associated risk.
Manages institutional marketing, student recruitment and external partnerships.
Defines and manages the institutional brand and marketing campaigns.
Defines institutional brand positioning and guidelines.
Creates and manages marketing content and digital assets.
Plans, executes and measures performance of marketing campaigns.
Manages recruitment activities for prospective students.
Captures and tracks data for prospective students.
Manages enquiries from prospective students.
Manages open days, recruitment fairs and visits.
Manages communications campaigns aimed at converting prospects to applicants.
Manages relationships and administration for collaborative academic partners.
Vets and selects appropriate collaborative partners.
Manages the creation, review and renewal of collaborative agreements.
Governs and monitors partner performance and quality.
Manages strategic external relationships with government, industry and community.
Manages relationships and lobbying activities with governmental bodies.
Manages non-research strategic relationships with industry.
Manages community engagement and public outreach programmes.
Manages the full employee lifecycle, payroll and workforce strategy.
Plans workforce needs and provides HR analytics.
Forecasts future staffing and skill requirements.
Provides workforce metrics and analytics (e.g., turnover, diversity).
Manages the recruitment process from vacancy to contract.
Manages the creation and approval of job requisitions.
Sources and tracks candidates through the recruitment pipeline.
Generates offers of employment and manages contracts.
Manages the onboarding of new employees including pre-employment checks.
Manages employee records, payroll and benefits.
Manages the single source of truth for employee data.
Calculates and processes employee payroll and ensures tax compliance.
Administers compensation and benefits schemes.
Manages employee leave requests and sickness absence.
Manages employee performance, training and development.
Manages the annual performance review cycle.
Assesses and tracks employee training and development needs.
Provides and manages the internal LMS for staff training.
Identifies and develops potential internal successors for key roles.
Manages the acquisition of goods and services and institutional spend.
Identifies sourcing strategies and manages supplier categories.
Analyses and reports on institutional spend by category.
Defines sourcing and negotiation strategies for key spend categories.
Manages the process from creating a requisition to payment.
Manages the creation and approval of internal purchasing requisitions.
Creates, transmits and tracks purchase orders.
Records receipt of goods and services and matches against P.O. and invoice.
Manages supplier contracts and ongoing supplier relationships.
Maintains a central register of institutional contracts.
Maintains and governs master data for all suppliers.
Monitors and manages supplier performance against agreed KPIs.
Manages the institutional property portfolio, facilities and environmental impact.
Delivers planned and reactive maintenance, and manages day-to-day operations (e.g., cleaning, catering).
Plans and executes scheduled preventative maintenance activities on building assets.
Manages fault reporting, work order creation, scheduling, and response to urgent repairs.
Manages the day-to-day operation of building fabric and services (e.g., HVAC, electrical).
Manages non-structural services like cleaning, catering, mail, and grounds maintenance.
Maintains a detailed register of building assets (e.g., plant, equipment) for lifecycle management.
Provides physical security, access control, and emergency planning.
Manages 24/7 security presence, patrol operations, and incident response.
Manages and configures access control systems, keys, and staff/student ID card permissions.
Operates and maintains the closed-circuit television and surveillance infrastructure.
Develops and tests emergency plans (e.g., fire, major incident) and coordinates first response.
Ensures institutional compliance with health and safety regulations, including risk assessment and training.
Provides information, collections, and learning spaces to support academic activity.
Provides structured development for core academic skills, including literacy and research.

systems.TEXT: 13.3. Manage library spaces and user services
systems.Description: Manages the physical and digital spaces, including service desk provision and lending operations.
Manages legal compliance for copyrighted content usage and administers licenses for resources.
Delivers technology services, infrastructure and cyber security.
Defines IT strategy, enterprise architecture and portfolio governance.
Defines the institutional IT strategy and roadmap.
Manages the institutional application, data and technology architecture.
Manages the institutional portfolio of IT projects and prioritisation.
Manages the IT Service Desk and operational IT service delivery.
Manages the IT Service Desk, incident logging and resolution.
Manages the investigation and resolution of root causes of recurring incidents.
Manages service level agreements and performance reporting.
Manages core IT infrastructure, cloud services and networking.
Manages wired and wireless networking infrastructure.
Manages physical and cloud-based server infrastructure.
Manages digital identities, authentication and authorisation.
Manages information security policy, defence and incident response.
Defines security policy and ensures compliance with relevant standards.
Monitors networks and systems to detect and prevent cyber threats.
Manages the response to and recovery from security incidents.
Manages institutional data assets, quality and business intelligence.
Governs institutional data policy, standards and quality.
Defines the institutional data strategy and roadmap.
Monitors, measures and improves institutional data quality.
Defines data ownership and stewardship roles.
Provides data insights, reports and dashboards.
Provides tools and platforms for self-service reporting and analysis.
Manages the central data warehouse/lake and ETL processes.
Develops and deploys predictive models (e.g., retention risk).
Supports the extraction and validation of data for statutory returns.
Processes and administers applications, allocations, contracts, and residential life support.

systems.TEXT: 4.3.1. Develop the accommodation guarantee and allocation policy
systems.Description: Defines eligibility, priority criteria, and deadlines for securing university or managed partnership accommodation.
Handles the application process, manages student room and flat preferences, and addresses specific requirements.
Executes the allocation process, issues room offers, manages the contract signing/acceptance, and oversees check-in/check-out procedures.
Manages the billing and collection of rent payments, including advance deposits, and handles rent adjustments or refunds.

systems.TEXT: 4.3.5. Deliver residential life support and conduct
systems.Description: Manages community standards, resident well-being, disciplinary issues, and out-of-hours support in residences.
Manages the annual cycle for planning, building, publishing, and maintaining the academic teaching timetable.
Sets the schedule for data collection, amendment periods, and draft/final publication dates for the academic year.
Gathers course, module, staff, and essential space data from academic departments for scheduling.
Uses scheduling algorithms to efficiently allocate teaching rooms, manage capacity, and monitor space usage against strategic KPIs.
Runs clash-checking procedures to eliminate conflicts between student enrollments, staff constraints, and module requirements.
Distributes final, personalized timetables to students and staff via online platforms.
Manages the process for approving and communicating necessary timetable amendments during the teaching term.
Manages the development of student skills, sourcing of placement opportunities, and compliance/risk for work experience.

systems.TEXT: 9.5.1. Develop student careers and skills programmes
systems.Description: Designs and delivers workshops, modules, and resources to enhance professional development and commercial awareness.

systems.TEXT: 9.5.2. Source and manage work placement opportunities
systems.Description: Establishes and maintains relationships with industry employers, secures placement roles, and manages exclusive placement job boards.
Defines the eligibility criteria and minimum standards for placements and formally approves them for degree credit.
Ensures safeguarding, completes risk assessments (e.g., Health & Safety), and maintains a full audit trail of compliance documentation.
Offers ongoing support, guidance, and monitoring to students while they are on placement to ensure success and address issues.
Defines and administers the career pathways for academic, teaching, and research staff.
Establishes distinct pathways for staff, such as Teaching & Research, Research-Only, and Teaching & Scholarship.
Manages the annual cycle for assessing and approving promotions based on defined academic criteria and contribution pillars.
Establishes the metrics and evidence required for core areas like Research, Education, and Engagement/Impact at each grade level.
Applies policies for Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI), and formally considers personal circumstances in career progression reviews.
Allocates teaching, research, and administrative duties to academic staff based on institutional models and equity principles.
Develops the long-term estate strategy, manages space allocation, and tracks performance across the property portfolio.
Creates and updates the strategic plan for the physical estate, aligning it with institutional academic and research objectives.
Manages the process for allocating space to academic and professional services departments based on needs and strategic priorities.
Collects and reports on space utilisation metrics (e.g., HESA EMR data submission).
Processes requests from departments to acquire, reconfigure, or release space, including financial impact assessment.
Manages the end-to-end lifecycle for major new builds, extensions, and strategic refurbishment programmes.
Conducts initial client briefing, pre-feasibility studies, and cost estimations for proposed capital works.
Manages the design process, including town planning approvals, environmental assessments, and detailed technical design.
Selects design teams and main contractors, manages the tendering process, and administers contracts.
Manages site safety, construction phases, budget control, and risk management through to practical completion.
Performs final financial close-out, project review, and post-occupancy evaluation.
Acquires, manages access to, and maintains the institution's content, prioritising digital resources.
Defines the strategy for acquiring content, prioritising digital resources and promoting open access.
Manages procurement, licensing, and access for physical and digital resources (e.g., "big deals" and PDA).
Develops and executes a digital preservation strategy to ensure long-term accessibility of e-content and institutional collections.
Maintains systems (e.g., catalogues, search layers) to enable seamless user discovery and authentication to licensed resources.

systems.TEXT: 13.4. Enable research data and open access
systems.Description: Provides services and infrastructure to support researchers in managing, sharing, and preserving their data and publications.
Offers guidance and infrastructure (e.g., repositories) for researchers to manage, store, and preserve their data throughout the research lifecycle.
Manages processes and funding to ensure research outputs are made openly available in line with funder and institutional policies.
Operates and maintains the platform for capturing, archiving, and disseminating the institution's research outputs and doctoral theses.

13.4. Enable research data and open access
13.4. Enable research data and open access
